instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: iMac 95° at GPU
threads.message:
iMac from 2009. Normal work. CPU at 45° And gpu at 95°
allready check and put New compound.
Next step is to replaced heatsink?

threads.title: iMac 95° at GPU
threads.message: Check if heat pipe works by heating it up and feeling if the other end gets warm.

threads.title: iMac 95° at GPU
threads.message:
GPU - 90º
Heatsink - 83º

Heatsink gets warm yes. Could be bad GPU or bad caps?

threads.title: iMac 95° at GPU
threads.message:
It is not 24. Here the model

[url]http://www.everymac.com/systems/apple/imac/specs/imac-core-2-duo-2.66-20-inch-aluminum-early-2008-penryn-specs.html[/url]

threads.title: iMac 95° at GPU
threads.message: Could be bad heat sink. Don't put anything on the VRAM, just use some compound on the GPU. No thermal pads or anything. If still no good try another heat sink.
